result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard D. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with J.D. unless approved by J.D. and DOC agent.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:32 AM Defendant Richard D. Clark in court by video in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution with attorney Kevin M Smith in person.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Victim K.S. appeared in court in person.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders sentence withheld 5 years probation consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. As a condition of a probation defendant is to have no contact with J.D. unless approved by J.D. and DOC agent. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit zero days.
Scheduling Letter from attorney Smith
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:05 AM Defendant Richard D. Clark in court in custody, by video with attorney Ashley Jade Morse by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Cole Gille sworn in and testified. Defense stipulates to identification of Defendant. Court takes judical notice of 19CF540. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Emmeline Lee appeared by video with legal intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $5000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.C.D, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No possession of any weapons or firearms. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
